page.title: 10A DAY IN MY LIFE.
page.content: This account is by Christian Mabey who lives at Newlands Prospect Farm, Monxton. I get up about 7:30. Then I get washed and dressed and go down for breakfast I usually have "Smacks" (a cereal) for breakfast and a cup of coffee. After breakfast I go out to help my dad load the tractor on to the lorry. The lorry is a Bedford "TK", the tractor is an old Field Marshall. My dad drives the tractor up the ramps and on to the lorry. When the tractor is on the lorry we rope it on, we put the ramps under the tractor and tie them on. Then we pull the caravan around and hitch it on the back of the lorry. Then my mum and dad and myself get into the lorry and set off for Bedford. It is a long ride to Bedford and boring too. When we arrive it is 1:30 p.m. Well my mum helps my dad
